title: The Circle of Fire
story_chunks: [clear throat] There was a man who walked many roads. And on those roads, he met thousands. Tens of thousands.
Names passed through him like wind through branches — remembered briefly, then gone. And the man thought: Am I alone?
For he saw others walking in packs. Hundreds, walking together. Laughing. Shouting. Filling the air with noise.
One night, by a fire that crackled and popped beneath stars, the man sat with three others. Four. That was all.
Let me tell you about the difference between a hundred friends and four.
See that flame? It burns hot. But if I took that same fire and spread it across a hundred campsites — nothing would catch.
But this fire — this one fire — it knows us. It has burned with us through storms.
When one of us stumbled, the others pulled them back to the warmth.
[sigh] I met thousands. I laughed with them, drank with them, worked beside them. But when I fell — really fell — who reached down?
Four. I can count on ONE HAND the people I'd take a bullet for.
That's not many. But each one of them is worth more than a thousand.
Because when you're sitting in the dark at 4 AM — it's not the thousand that show up. It's the four.
Because being real is hard. You can't do it with everybody.
That's exhausting to be around. So I found people who don't do that. People who are actually WITH you. Just... there. Real.
Finding those people — man, it's rare. I've walked a lot of roads and I can count them on one hand.
You don't need many. What you want is a few who are REAL. And when you find them — you hold on tight.
[chuckle] Struggle builds us. That's what forges the bond. With the fire, we're family. Not by blood. Just by choice. We CHOSE.
lesson_chunks: A hundred acquaintances won't hold you when you fall. Four will.
I can name on ONE HAND the people I'd take a bullet for.
Being real is rare, and it exhausts you — save it for those who deserve it.
Struggle together builds bonds that nothing else can.
Hold tight to the ones who stayed. They are worth more than you know.
